subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: I ll re-add section F. Although the section F information is extremely useful, I don t see how it affects the proposal. It seems to me F can be treated as
messageBody:
I'll re-add section F.

Although the section F information is extremely useful, I don't see how
it affects the proposal.
It seems to me F can be treated as identical to E when deciding which
code points should be reused.
As far as I can see the UCD has no properties which can relate code
points by sound.

Have I miss-read (yet again!) the specification?
Or is that information stored in a completely different location?
Or is it just that the information should be included with the proposal
for completeness?

Could you explain for me?

John Cowan wrote:
>
> amd64_hacker scripsit:
>
> > I've omitted sections A and F from the XSLT for the moment as they don't
> > have a direct impact on the proposal.
>
> I agree that A (Shavian-only) is not necessary, but F (one match for
> sound, one for sight) is critical. For example, QS F matches Shavian
> F in sound, Shavian TH in shape.
>
> --
> MEET US AT POINT ORANGE AT MIDNIGHT BRING YOUR DUCK OR PREPARE TO FACE
> WUGGUMS
> John Cowan cowan@... <mailto:cowan%40ccil.org>
> http://www.ccil.org/~cowan <http://www.ccil.org/%7Ecowan>
>
>

As far as I can see the UCD has no properties which can relate code
